meanings.sent1: The estimates for the project cost were way off.
meanings.sent2: Her estimates of how many jellybeans were in the jar were surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent3: The estimates for how long it would take to bake the cake were way too high!
meanings.sent4: His estimates of the number of stars in the sky were as countless as grains of sand.
meanings.sent5: The estimates of the treasure's location led them on a wild goose chase.

meanings.definition: To form an opinion about something without having all the details.
meanings.sent1: She estimates that the movie will be good based on the trailer.
meanings.sent2: He estimates the weather will be sunny tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: I estimate that the cat is plotting something mischievous.
meanings.sent4: The detective estimated the culprit's identity before the final reveal.
meanings.sent5: Estimating the taste of the soup, she added more salt to be safe.

meanings.definition: To give a general idea of the value, size, or cost of something.
meanings.sent1: The real estate agent estimates the house's value at $500,000.
meanings.sent2: He estimates the weight of the package to be around 5 pounds.
meanings.sent3: Estimating the distance to the moon, he pointed up and said, 'It's far.'
meanings.sent4: She estimates the time it will take to finish the race at just under an hour.
meanings.sent5: The chef estimates the cost of the meal to be within the budget.
